ratings.comment: Very passionate. Lots of writing, but that's also the whole point of the class.

Very helpful and understanding. The department switched the website the semester that I took the class, but Jamie was very thoughtful in taking workload into account with the new system and encouraged the department head to alter essays and assignments to be more realistic for the timeline. Very involved in classes and easily available outside them

Classes are very active, and you will be expected to answer questions every class for your participation grade. He gives good feedback and as long as you put a little bit of effort into the essay and assignments you will get a good grade.

Jamie friendly, funny, and wants you to be successful. He speaks mostly in Spanish, so I don't feel like a learn a ton about grammar in class. You must do a lot of the learning outside of class, and then in-class is mostly just practicing. All the homework is entirely online and is auto-graded which is a little frustrating. You must write 6 essays.

Super nice guy and always gives really helpful feedback. Grade is based on progress throughout the semester and participation is heavily encouraged. He's very understanding and makes the class engaging.

Jamie is hilarious, and I had a great time in his class. Absence policy is strict, but not inflexible, and he cares about students. I frequently felt I did not understand what he was looking for in my essays, and wasn't sure what he wanted from me. Graded for participation and progress, but didn't understand what he wanted me to improve on.

Good instructor, hard to catch up if you're behind on certain topics from previous teaching, moves very quickly, encourages participation heavily, nice and very funny, easy to approach and responds to emails quickly, lots of homework (mostly busy work)

I had Jamie during the second half of a summer Spanish session and I wish he would have been the professor the whole time. My understanding of the material and engagement in class approved with his group work, discussion focused class. There is ALOT of homework and participation is heavily stressed.
jamie is very helpful and always answers his email to help you and give you feedback

Super flexible when it comes to getting stuff done, all the feedback is stuff that you can use, and he goes a little fast in lectures but he's more than happy to stop and give you a chance to catch up. Great guy, strongly recommend.

You'd have to be insane not to love this man. Very easy going and nice, super flexible, always available for help, his feedback is thorough, thoughtful, and helpful, and his lectures do a great job balance challenging you to work on your Spanish listening.
Jamie was awesome through and through. Super understanding and accommodating, nice guy, and just all around made Spanish class about as good as it could be.
Really great and reasonable teacher. Extremely helpful and nice and is not strict about policies. He is very understanding towards any problems you may have as long as you communicate them.

Such a sweet guy. Really cares for his student's success. Class is relatively easy overall, but having him as a prof just makes it so much better. Attendance is a pretty important section of grade, as is participation. A good amount of time goes into the homework but it really does help you learn. Test formats are predictable and easy to comprehend

best professor I've ever had. He really cares about his students and is easy to talk to if you have any questions after class. You need to participate in class for part of your grade, so be ready to be called on. However he is really understanding of different skill levels so don't be intimidated. Also he only talks in Spanish in class. Great prof!

He was a great teacher that cared a lot about the students success. He always wanted to help you improve and understand Spanish better. I wasn't the best at Spanish so it was a somewhat difficult class, but without him, it would have been much harder.
Would reccomend, fair and the class wasn't too hard to pass even though I suck at Spanish.

An amazing prof/TA! Cares a lot about students and their success. There is a decent amount of homework. You are only allowed to skip 3 classes before your grade drops, so attendance is mandatory. He ONLY speaks in Spanish during class unless a concept needs to be understood better, and participation is key. Overall a good TA and super funny!
